page.title: 04ECOLOGY, FAUNA, STANFORD
page.content: Intensive cultivation with destruction or trimming back of hedges had resulted in the decrease of many country birds and animals until the last year or two. A more positive conservation policy seems to be encouraging their resurgence.Coppicing of part of Hayton Wood will,it is hoped,bring back the nightingale and woodpecker. Tree planting nearer the Downs has encouraged the return of badgers.Foxes abound,the rabbit also. Traffic on the lanes has,on the other hand,decimated the hedgehog,& in only one small area are glow worms to be found. Elvers have disappeared from the springs. Two large mixed farms sustain large herds,one of pediigree dairy cattle,the other of sheep being bred experimentally as cross between Romneys & the German Oldenburg.
